lines.content: * The main class for the Plato Task Manager application.
* It initializes and runs the task management system, handling user input and executing commands.
* Constructs a Plato instance, initializing UI, storage, and loading tasks from the file.
* @param filePath The file path to load and store tasks persistently.
* Runs the task management system, processing user input until an exit command is issued.
* The main entry point for the Plato Task Manager application.

* Represents an abstract command that can be executed within the task manager.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks   The task list to be modified or accessed.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage system to persist task data.
* @throws PlatoException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PlatoException;
* Determines whether this command should terminate the program.
* @return {@code true} if the command exits the program, otherwise {@code false}.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand by extracting the task number from user input.
* @param input The raw user input specifying which task to delete.
* @throws PlatoException If the input format is invalid.
throw new PlatoException("Invalid format for delete.");

* @param storage The storage system to persist the changes.
* @throws PlatoException If an error occurs while accessing the task list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PlatoException {
* Represents a command to exit the program.

storage = new Storage("testTasks.txt");  // Can mock this in real scenarios
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand("todo Read a book", TaskType.TODO);
assertEquals(1, taskList.size(), "Task list should have 1 task after adding a ToDo");
assertEquals("Read a book", taskList.getAllTasks().get(0).getDescription(), "The task description should match the input");
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand("deadline Submit report /by 2025-02-14 2359", TaskType.DEADLINE);
assertEquals(1, taskList.size(), "Task list should have 1 task after adding a Deadline");
assertTrue(taskList.getAllTasks().get(0).toString().contains("Submit report"), "Deadline task description should match the input");
"Deadline date should match the input format in the toString() method");
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand("event Meeting /from 2025-02-14 1400 /to 2025-02-14 1600", TaskType.EVENT);
assertEquals(1, taskList.size(), "Task list should have 1 task after adding an Event");
assertTrue(taskList.getAllTasks().get(0).toString().contains("Meeting"), "Event task description should match the input");
"Event start time should match the input format in the toString() method");
assertTrue(taskList.getAllTasks().get(0).toString().contains("Feb 14 2025, 4:00 pm"), "Event end time should match the input");
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand("deadline Finish assignment /by wrong-date", TaskType.DEADLINE);
Exception exception = assertThrows(PlatoException.class, () -> addCommand.execute(taskList, ui, storage));
assertEquals("Invalid date format! Use: yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (e.g., 2023-12-02 1800).", exception.getMessage());
AddCommand addCommand = new AddCommand("event Team meeting /from 2025-02-14 1400", TaskType.EVENT);

storage = new Storage("testTasks.txt");  // Can be mocked if needed

assertDoesNotThrow(() -> mockCommand.execute(taskList, ui, storage), "MockCommand should execute without throwing exceptions");
Exception exception = assertThrows(PlatoException.class, () -> failingCommand.execute(taskList, ui, storage));
